section.para: This function allows you to initiate the Term Deposit (TD) transaction and provide maturity/interest payment and withdrawal instructions. The bank and customer can also make inquiry on the TD transaction which has been created in the Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.title: Term Deposit Landing Page
section.para:
The Term Deposit Landing page displays a list of TD transactions made by the user, that in various stages of their life cycle. The requests are displayed in multiple tabs based on the current status of request. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.
You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.
The following image illustrates the Term Deposit Landing page:

listitem.para: Use this option to initiate a new Term Deposit and submit it to the bank.

section.para:
The Term Deposit listing page segregates transactions based on their current status like draft, pending approval from client or bank, future dated, completed, rejected from bank and purged.The following ribbon items enable you to perform various actions on individual transaction or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Tab
Description
Draft
Lists all the term deposit transactions that are in draft state and also the transactions that checker has returned for improvement.
Draft tab is available only to maker user.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing TD requests that are awaiting client approval from a second user within the corporate.
The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing Term Deposit requests that are awaiting bank approval.
Future Dated
Lists all the Term Deposit transactions that are to be initiated on a future date.
Live
Lists all the completed Term Deposit transactions.
Completed
Lists all the completed Term Deposit transactions.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Term Deposit transactions by the bank. The status given to such records is "Not Processed".
Purged
Lists all the Term Deposit transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Entity, Channel Reference, Bank Reference and Value Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant Term Deposit requests. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched. You can also save filter preference by clicking on Save as New View and enter the name of new view, you may also select "Make Preference as Default" to set the default preference to newly created view.

You can perform the following actions on the listed cheque requests:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of loan transactions.
CSV Download: Download the list of loan transactions displayed on the dashboard.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed loan transactions.
Customize: You can customize the order in which the cheque book request information is displayed. You can achieve following customizations through this feature:
Select the columns that you wish to display, unselect the column names to hide the columns.
Click on lock icon to freeze the position of the column. The freezed columns are placed on the left of screen. You can freeze a maximum of three columns.
You can drag and drop a column name to rearrange the table columns. Hover over multiple dots icon against each column name to, a hand icon appears, which suggests that the column is ready to be dragged and dropped.
This feature is available for all the tables of Fusion Corporate Channels.

section.title: Information on Actions
section.para: This section describes all the actions that you can perform on loan transactions. The actions are available in relevant tabs based on the ribbon you are on.

listitem.para: Actions are based on the user persona, like a maker user will have the action Edit (update an existing transaction), View (view the details of the individual transactions), Details (view the full details of the transactions), Discard (delete an existing draft transaction).

section.title: Transaction Details
section.para: This section describes the information presented on clicking the details button against any given transaction:

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the Term Deposit details. The information is spread over two tabs which are described below:
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the cheque book request transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab opens details in read-only mode.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.
Additional Information: Lists the 'Customer Attachments' added as part of this transaction.

You can perform following actions on the opened transactions:
Term Deposit Landing: Click on this icon to navigate back to Term Deposit Landing page.
Journey: You can view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.

section.title: Open Term Deposit
section.para:
Click on this
icon to initiate a Term Deposit.

section.title: General Details
section.para: The General Details form for Term Deposit initiation comprises of the following fields:

entry.para: Field
Description

Enter the Entity name making the application. This field is only present if your company has entities defined and you are attached to one or more entities. If you are attached to more than one, click on the dropdown box to select one. If you are attached to only one, the field is preset to that entity and cannot be changed.
Enter the value date Term Deposit Initiation is to be submitted.
Enter the type of deposit being made.
Slide the icon if you wish to enter custom tenor period for the Term Deposit. You can enter the period in years/months/days or directly enter the number of days.
The entire list of Tenor will depend on 'Tenor Period' parameter set by the bank.
Click on the View Interest Rate retrieved from the back office for the specified tenor, CCY and amount indicated in the input screen.
Enter the Term Deposit currency.
Enter the Amount for which Term Deposit is to be initiated.

Select the Maturity Instructions to the bank for paying the matured amount and/or Interest. Available options are: Auto Renewal of Principal and Interest Auto Renewal of Principal and Credit Interest to Account Credit Principal and Interest to Account
Enter the account from which the Term Deposit amount is to be withdrawn.

Enter the account the matured deposit and/or Interest should be paid into. Click the dropdown to display a list of available accounts. You can use debit account as credit account also by clicking the checkbox "Use same account as debit account".
Enter any additional transaction remarks that are applicable.

section.title: Term Deposit Update/Withdraw
section.para:
To update or withdraw Term Deposit, navigate to Account Services > Account Summary and click on the update
icon or withdraw
icon against the transaction to initiate an update or withdrawal.

section.para: The General Details form for Term Deposit update or withdrawal comprises of the following fields:

entry.para: Field
Description
Name of the bank holding the requested account.
Date on which the deposit is set to mature.
Amount, at the time of maturity.
The account from which the Term Deposit amount is withdrawn.
